```{r}
dist_tbl <- flights |> filter(month==1) |> group_by(carrier) |> summarise(mean_distance = mean(distance, na.rm = TRUE),
    sd_distance = sd(distance, na.rm = TRUE))  |> arrange(mean_distance)

dist_tbl
```

##3. \*\*Zero\*\* standard deviation and \*\*NA\*\* standard deviation\
\
If a carrier has only \*\*one observation\*\*, the standard deviation formula divides by ( n - 1). Since (n = 1) we get \*\*division by zero\*\*, which results in \`NA\`.

```{r}
na_summaries <- flights |> filter(month ==1 ,carrier=='OO') |> summarise( Number_of_flights = n(),
    mean_dist = mean(distance, na.rm = TRUE),
    sd_dist = sd(distance, na.rm = TRUE))
na_summaries
```

If all values in a dataset are **identical**, their **standard deviation is 0** because there is **no variation.\
**

```{r}
YV <- flights |> filter(month ==1 , carrier=='YV') |> select(flight, distance) 

print(YV, n = Inf)

z_summaries <- YV|> summarise( Number_of_flights = n(),
    mean_d= mean(distance, na.rm = TRUE),
    sd_d= sd(distance, na.rm = TRUE))
z_summaries
```

##4.

```{r}
carrier_delay_df <- flights |> 
  group_by(month, carrier) |> 
  summarise(avg_dep_delay = mean(dep_delay, na.rm = TRUE), .groups = "drop") |> 
  pivot_wider(names_from = carrier, values_from = avg_dep_delay)


carrier_delay_df
```

##5. Proportion of flights that were delayed but arrived before time

```{r}
proportion_delayed_but_on_time <- flights |> 
  filter(dep_delay > 0, arr_delay <= 0) |> 
  summarise(proportion = n() / nrow(flights))

proportion_delayed_but_on_time
```

##airlines and flights data set\

```{r}
#Step 1:
routes_multiple_airlines <- flights |>
  group_by(origin, dest)|>
  filter(n_distinct(carrier) > 1) |>
  ungroup()

routes_multiple_airlines

#Step 2:
route_delays <- routes_multiple_airlines |>
  group_by(origin, dest, carrier) |>
  summarise(avg_arr_delay = mean(arr_delay, na.rm = TRUE), .groups = "drop")

route_delays

#Step 3:

route_performance <- route_delays |>
  group_by(origin, dest) |>
  summarise(
    worst_airline = carrier[which.max(avg_arr_delay)],
    worst_delay = max(avg_arr_delay),
    best_airline = carrier[which.min(avg_arr_delay)],
    best_delay = min(avg_arr_delay),
    .groups = "drop"
  )

route_performance

#Step 4:

route_performance <- route_performance |>
  mutate(delay_difference = worst_delay - best_delay)

route_with_max_difference <- route_performance |>
  filter(delay_difference == max(delay_difference))

route_with_max_difference
```
